DataElement.preferredName: Patient Radiation Therapy Prior Registration Exclusion Criteria Ind-2
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the yes/no indicator whether there was administration of treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation prior to registration or enrollment on a clinical trial as a medical and/or social characteristic that prevents a subject from being allowed to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Patient Radiation Therapy Prior Registration Exclusion Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the administration of treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation prior to registration or enrollment on a clinical trial as a medical and/or social characteristic that prevents a subject from being allowed to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredName: Radiation Therapy Prior Registration Exclusion Criteria
Property.preferredDefinition: use PHOTOTHERAPY, LASER THERAPY, or ULTRAVIOLET THERAPY for therapeutic radiation with visible, laser, or ultraviolet light, respectively.:Earlier in time or order.:Registration; the act of enrolling.:Exclusion; the act of restricting entrance or barring from participation.

Concepts.definition: Treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation. Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation.
The act of listing or recording officially; officially qualified or enrolled.
Medical and/or social characteristics that prevent a subject from being allowed to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: 10.3.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED PHASED OUT to RETIRED ARCHIVED. Changed Workflow Status DBW 04-27-2016

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 8/29/17 tt added CSI per Round 5 finalization task. 3/12/17 jk added Standard reg status; ownership transfered from CTEP to NCI Standards with concurrence of CTEP/Brian Campbell. jk

ReferenceDocuments.name: Radiotherapy <=4 weeks prior
ReferenceDocuments.description: Radiotherapy <=4 weeks prior to registration, except if to a non-target lesion only. Prior radiation to a target lesion is permitted only if there has been clear progression of the lesion since radiation was completed.

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text
ReferenceDocuments.description: Prior radiation completed >=4 weeks prior to study enrollment, and associated toxicities resolved to eligibility levels.

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has any prior radiation therapy been completed at least 4 weeks prior to registration?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient had prior radiation for localized cancer of the breast, head and neck, thyroid, or skin completed more than 5 years prior to registration and has the patient remained free of recurrent or metastatic disease?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has prior radiation therapy for treatment of endometrial carcinoma been completed at least 4 weeks prior to the first date of study therapy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did the patient have prior radiation therapy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF_Text_6
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did the patient receive prior radiation therapy for treatment of endometrial cancer?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_CRF_TEXT1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient had radiation therapy (except palliative RT to relieve bone pain) within 2 weeks of study entry OR stereotactic/small field brain irradiation within 1 week of study entry?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_CRF_TEXT2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient had whole brain RT/other palliative RT within 2 weeks of study entry OR stereotactic/small field brain irradiation within 1 week prior to study entry?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_eCRF_Text
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has all prior radiation therapy been completed at least 4 weeks prior to registration?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_CRF_Text3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has radiation therapy been completed at least 4 weeks prior to registration?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG CRF Text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient received palliative RT within 30 days prior to registration?

DataElement.origin: NCCTG CRF:North Central Cancer Treatment Group Case Report Form
DataElement.changeDescription: Replaced VD Eligibility Ind-2 2018257v1 with VD ID#3506068 - Yes No Indicator - dbw
